Content.title: Sebastiaan Janssen
Content.name: Sebastiaan Janssen
Content.bodyText:
It is possible to do some registry hacking and create dependencies for services, but that might be worse than this solution, which is a quite nice hack in actually.

The real correct solution however, would be if Umbraco actually did a fallback to the disk cache as long as it can't access the database server. This is how it used to work in 4.0.x, except I don't think it ever went looking for the SQL server after the fallback.
